statements.name: PROC CATALOG
statements.description: Copies entries from one SAS catalog to another.

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog to process.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing of the current PROC CATALOG step to one entry type.

arguments.name: FORCE
arguments.description: forces statements to execute on a catalog that is opened by another resource environment.

arguments.name: KILL
arguments.description: affects the specified catalog and deletes all entries in a SAS catalog.

statements.name: CHANGE
statements.description: Renames one or more catalog entry names.

arguments.name: old-name=
arguments.description: specifies the current name of a catalog entry and the new name that you want to assign to it. Specify any valid SAS name.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.

statements.name: CONTENTS
statements.description: Lists the contents of a catalog in the procedure output or writes a list of the contents to a SAS data set, an external file, or both.

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog to process.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: sends the contents to an external file that is identified with a SAS fileref.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: sends the contents to a SAS data set. When the statement executes, a message in the SAS log reports that a data set has been created. The data set contains six variables in the following order:

statements.name: COPY
statements.description: Copies some or all of the entries in one catalog to another catalog.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the catalog to which entries are copied.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one type of entry.

arguments.name: IN=
arguments.description: copies from a different catalog in the same step.

arguments.name: LOCKCAT=
arguments.description: enables concurrent users to copy to the same catalog at the same time.

arguments.name: MOVE
arguments.description: copies and then deletes a catalog entry.

arguments.name: NEW
arguments.description: copies entries to a new catalog (overwriting the catalog if it already exists).

arguments.name: NOEDIT
arguments.description: protects several types of SAS/AF entries from being edited with PROC BUILD.

arguments.name: NOSOURCE
arguments.description: does not copy source lines from a PROGRAM, FRAME, or SCL entry.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes entries from a SAS catalog.

arguments.name: entry-1
arguments.description: specifies the name of one or more SAS catalog entries.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.

statements.name: EXCHANGE
statements.description: Switches the name of two catalog entries.

arguments.name: name=
arguments.description: specifies two catalog entry names that the procedure switches.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.

statements.name: EXCLUDE
statements.description: Specifies entries that the COPY statement does not copy.

arguments.name: entry-1
arguments.description: specifies the name of one or more SAS catalog entries.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.

statements.name: MODIFY
statements.description: Changes the description of a catalog entry.

arguments.name: entry
arguments.description: specifies the name of one SAS catalog entry. You can specify the entry type with the name (entry-name.entry-type).

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: changes the description of a catalog entry by replacing it with a new description, up to 256 characters long, or by removing it altogether. You can enclose the description in single or double quotation marks.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.

statements.name: SAVE
statements.description: Specifies entries not to delete from a SAS catalog.

arguments.name: entry-1
arguments.description: specifies the name of one or more SAS catalog entries.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Specifies entries that the COPY statement copies.

arguments.name: entry-1
arguments.description: specifies the name of one or more SAS catalog entries.

arguments.name: ENTRYTYPE=
arguments.description: restricts processing to one entry type.
